channel.title: Alexander Soto | Bridging Social Justice and Technology
channel.description: Recent content on Alexander Soto | Bridging Social Justice and Technology

item.title: Humble Beginnings
item.description: Testing this out My beginnings with technology starts in early childhood. During the weekends I visited my father and spent most of the time with my brother Robinson. Robinson, an electrical engineer from Dominican Republic, was my mentor and role-model. When I visited during the weekend I would find my brother taking apart and repairing different devices. I looked forward to spending time with him and I would ask questions about technology, such as “What is RAM?

Robinson, an electrical engineer from Dominican Republic, was my mentor and role-model. When I visited during the weekend I would find my brother taking apart and repairing different devices. I looked forward to spending time with him and I would ask questions about technology, such as “What is RAM?

item.title: Starting Graduate School
item.description: test I’m a graduate student at Northeastern University and part of the ALIGN program pursuing a master’s degree in Computer Science. The ALIGN program consists of a series of bridge courses for graduate students that didn’t major in Computer Science in their undergraduate studies. Upon completion of the ALIGN program students begin taking graduate level classes in computer science. I’m currently taking CS5002 - Discrete Math - from the Northeastern University course description catalog:
